00045   m_kind_char='F';
00046   init();

00049 affx::File5_File::~File5_File()
00050 {
00051   close();
00052   // whine if there are objects which refer to this one.
00053   if (refcnt()!=0) {
00054 #ifdef FILE5_DEBUG_PRINT
00055     printf("m_refcnt==%d\n",refcnt());
00056 #endif
00057     //assert(0);
00058   }
00059 }

00062 affx::File5_File::init()
00063 {

00065   //
00066   m_kind=affx::FILE5_KIND_FILE;
00067   m_kind_char='F';
00068   //
00069   return affx::FILE5_OK;
00070 }

00083 affx::File5_return_t
00084 affx::File5_File::dump1()
00085 {
00086   refcnt_print();
00087   //
00088   printf("   m_file_name    = '%s'\n",m_file_name.c_str());
00089   //printf("   m_h5_file_id   = %d\n",m_h5_file_id);
00090   printf("   m_refcnt       = %d\n",m_refcnt);
00091   return affx::File5_Group::dump1();
00092 }

00102 bool
00103 affx::File5_File::isHdf5file(const std::string& file_name)
00104 {
00105   std::string tmp_unc_path=file_name;
00106   Fs::convertToUncPathInPlace(tmp_unc_path,10);
00107 
00108   if (Fs::isReadable(tmp_unc_path) &&
00109       H5Fis_hdf5(tmp_unc_path.c_str())==1) {
00110     return true;
00111   }
00112   //
00113   return false;
00114 }

00117 //
00118 affx::File5_return_t
00119 affx::File5_File::open(const std::string& file_name,int flags)
00120 {
00121   //int rv;
00122   //struct stat stat_buf;
00123   std::string tmp_unc_path=file_name;
00124   Fs::convertToUncPathInPlace(tmp_unc_path, 10);
00125 
00126   if (refcnt()!=0) {
00127     FILE5_ABORT("file still has "+ToStr(refcnt())+" open references.");
00128   }
00129   
00130   setFilename(file_name);
00131   m_flags=flags;
00132   m_readonly=true;
00133 
00134   // replace means get rid of the orginal and implies create
00135   if ((flags&FILE5_REPLACE)==FILE5_REPLACE) {
00136 #ifdef FILE5_DEBUG_PRINT
00137     printf("### file5: file replace: '%s'\n",m_file_name.c_str());
00138 #endif
00139     m_h5_obj=H5Fcreate(tmp_unc_path.c_str(), H5F_ACC_TRUNC, H5P_DEFAULT, H5P_DEFAULT);
00140     if ( m_h5_obj < 1 ) {
00141       Verbose::out(1, "H5Fcreate failed on absolute path, trying relative..." + file_name);
00142       m_h5_obj=H5Fcreate(file_name.c_str(), H5F_ACC_TRUNC, H5P_DEFAULT, H5P_DEFAULT);
00143       if ( m_h5_obj >= 0 ) {
00144         Verbose::out(1, "H5Fcreate ok for relative path: " + file_name);
00145       }
00146     }    
00147     FILE5_CHECKID(m_h5_obj,"could not replace "+FS_QUOTE_PATH(file_name));
00148     m_readonly=false;
00149   }
00150   //
00151   else if (((flags&FILE5_OPEN)==FILE5_OPEN)&&(isHdf5file(m_file_name)==1)) {
00152     // printf("### file5: file open: '%s'\n",m_file_name.c_str());
00153     // check to see if it exists
00154     if (!Fs::isReadable(tmp_unc_path)) {
00155       FILE5_ABORT("File does not exist or is not readable: "+FS_QUOTE_PATH(tmp_unc_path));
00156     }
00157     //
00158     int h5_open_flags;
00159     if ((flags&affx::FILE5_RO)==affx::FILE5_RO) {
00160       h5_open_flags=H5F_ACC_RDONLY;
00161       m_readonly=true;
00162     }
00163     else {
00164       h5_open_flags=H5F_ACC_RDWR;
00165       m_readonly=false;
00166     }
00167     m_h5_obj=H5Fopen(tmp_unc_path.c_str(),h5_open_flags,H5P_DEFAULT);
00168     FILE5_CHECKID(m_h5_obj,"could not open: "+FS_QUOTE_PATH(tmp_unc_path));
00169   }
00170   else if ((flags&FILE5_CREATE)==FILE5_CREATE) {
00171 #ifdef FILE5_DEBUG_PRINT
00172     printf("### file5: file create: '%s'\n",tmp_unc_path.c_str());
00173 #endif
00174     m_h5_obj=H5Fcreate(tmp_unc_path.c_str(), H5F_ACC_EXCL, H5P_DEFAULT, H5P_DEFAULT);
00175     FILE5_CHECKID(m_h5_obj,"could not create: "+FS_QUOTE_PATH(tmp_unc_path));
00176     //
00177     m_readonly=false;
00178   }
00179   else if ((flags&FILE5_OPEN)==FILE5_OPEN) {
00180     printf("### file5: file open: unable to open: '%s'\n",tmp_unc_path.c_str());
00181     return affx::FILE5_ERR;
00182   }
00183   else {
00184     FILE5_ABORT("Bad set of flags passed to File5_File::open()");
00185   }
00186 
00187   // we dont bump the refcnt, we loop back the parent to ourselves
00188   setParent(this);
00189   setFile(this);
00190   m_state=affx::FILE5_STATE_OPEN;
00191 
00192   //
00193 #ifdef FILE5_DEBUG_PRINT
00194   printf("### File5_File::open()==%d\n",m_h5_obj);
00195 #endif
00196 
00197   return affx::FILE5_OK;
00198 }
00199 
00200 bool
00201 affx::File5_File::is_open()
00202 {
00203   // using "0" and "1" as this returns a boolean.
00204   if (m_h5_obj==-1) {
00205     return false;
00206   }
00207   else {
00208     return true;
00209   }
00210 }
00211 
00212 affx::File5_return_t
00213 affx::File5_File::close()
00214 {
00215   flush();
00216 
00217   // warn about unclosed references.
00218   if (refcnt()!=0) {
00219     printf("File5_File::close('%s'): refcnt==%d\n",m_file_name.c_str(),refcnt());
00220     // abort before deallocating resources for debugging.
00221     // FILE5_ABORT("File5_File::close(): refcnt!=0");
00222     // return 0;
00223   }
00224 
00225   // we will close the file ourselves, with H5Fclose.
00226   // let the group have its turn.
00227   hid_t tmp_h5_obj=m_h5_obj;
00228   m_h5_obj=-1;
00229   affx::File5_Group::close();
00230   //
00231   if (tmp_h5_obj!=-1) {
00232     m_h5_status=H5Fclose(tmp_h5_obj);
00233     FILE5_CHECKRV(m_h5_status,"H5Fclose failed.");
00234   }
00235   //
00236   return affx::FILE5_OK;
00237 }
00238 
00239 affx::File5_return_t
00240 affx::File5_File::flush()
00241 {
00242   // for debugging to check that flush is called.
00243   // printf("FLUSH ==========\n"); sleep(2);
00244   if (m_h5_obj!=-1) {
00245     m_h5_status=H5Fflush(m_h5_obj,H5F_SCOPE_GLOBAL);
00246     FILE5_CHECKRV(m_h5_status,"H5Fflush failed.");
00247   }
00248   return affx::FILE5_OK;
00249 }
00250 
00251 // I think this is a better signature. - jhg
00252 // bool affx::File5_File::equivalent(
00253 // const std::string& strFileName1,
00254 // const std::string& strTsvName1,
00255 // const std::string& strFileName2,
00256 // const std::string& strTsvName2,
00257 // std::set<std::string>& setIgnore, 
00258 // double dEpsilon, 
00259 // double dCorrelationCutoff)
00260 bool affx::File5_File::equivalent(      const std::string& strFileName1, 
00261                                         const std::string& strFileName2, 
00262                                         const std::string& strGroupName, 
00263                                         const std::string& strTsvName, std::set<std::string>& setIgnore, 
00264                                         double dEpsilon, 
00265                                         double dCorrelationCutoff,
00266                                         bool bAllowNegation,
00267                                         bool flagNaNNumDiff)
00268 {
00269         Verbose::out(1, strFileName1);
00270         Verbose::out(1, strFileName2);
00271         Verbose::out(1, "Comparing " + strGroupName + "." + strTsvName);
00272         bool bSuccessful = true;
00273         double d1 = 0;
00274         double d2 = 0;
00275         float f1 = 0;
00276         float f2 = 0;
00277         int i1 = 0;
00278         int i2 = 0;
00279         char c1 = 0;
00280         char c2 = 0;
00281         std::string str1;
00282         std::string str2;
00283 
00284         if (!isHdf5file(strFileName1)) {Verbose::out(1, "File: " + strFileName1 + " is not an HDF5 file."); return false;}
00285         if (!isHdf5file(strFileName2)) {Verbose::out(1, "File: " + strFileName2 + " is not an HDF5 file."); return false;}
00286 
00287         int iCount1 = affx::File5_Tsv::getFileTsvLineCount(strFileName1, strGroupName, strTsvName);
00288         int iCount2 = affx::File5_Tsv::getFileTsvLineCount(strFileName2, strGroupName, strTsvName);
00289         if (iCount1 != iCount2) {Verbose::out(1, "Tsv Line Counts do not match for Group: " + strGroupName + ", Tsv: " + strTsvName); return false;}
00290         if (iCount1<0 && iCount2<0) {Verbose::out(1, "Missing from both files, skipping test for Group: " + strGroupName + ", Tsv: " + strTsvName); return true;}  // files match if both files do not have the Group and/or TSV Column
00291 
00292         affx::File5_File file1;
00293         affx::File5_File file2;
00294         // affx::File5_File* file1=new File5_File();
00295         affx::File5_Group* group1 = NULL;
00296         affx::File5_Group* group2 = NULL;
00297         affx::File5_Tsv* tsv1 = NULL;
00298         affx::File5_Tsv* tsv2 = NULL;
00299         file1.open(strFileName1, affx::FILE5_OPEN_RO);
00300         file2.open(strFileName2, affx::FILE5_OPEN_RO);
00301         group1 = file1.openGroup(strGroupName, affx::FILE5_OPEN_RO);
00302         group2 = file2.openGroup(strGroupName, affx::FILE5_OPEN_RO);
00303         tsv1 = group1->openTsv(strTsvName, affx::FILE5_OPEN_RO);
00304         tsv2 = group2->openTsv(strTsvName, affx::FILE5_OPEN_RO);
00305         /// @todo the above is too complicated - jhg
00306         //  They should both be this:
00307         // tsv1=file1->openTsv(strTsvName1,affx::FILE5_OPEN_RO)
00308         int iColumnCount1 = tsv1->getColumnCount(0);
00309         int iColumnCount2 = tsv2->getColumnCount(0);
00310         if (iColumnCount1 != iColumnCount2) {Verbose::out(1, "Tsv Column Counts do not match for Group: " + strGroupName + ", Tsv: " + strTsvName); bSuccessful = false;}
00311         else
00312         {
00313                 for (int iColumnIndex = 0; (iColumnIndex < iColumnCount1); iColumnIndex++)
00314                 {
00315                         tsv1->close();
00316                         tsv2->close();
00317                         delete tsv1;
00318                         delete tsv2;
00319                         tsv1 = group1->openTsv(strTsvName, affx::FILE5_OPEN_RO);
00320                         tsv2 = group2->openTsv(strTsvName, affx::FILE5_OPEN_RO);
00321                         double dMaxDifference = 0;
00322                         AffxMultiDimensionalArray<double> mx(iCount1, 2);
00323                         std::string strColumnName1;
00324                         std::string strColumnName2;
00325                         tsv1->getColumnName(0, iColumnIndex, &strColumnName1);
00326                         tsv2->getColumnName(0, iColumnIndex, &strColumnName2);
00327                         if (strColumnName1 != strColumnName2) {Verbose::out(1, "Tsv Column Names do not match for Group: " + strGroupName + ", Tsv: " + strTsvName + ", Column: " + ToStr(iColumnIndex)); bSuccessful = false; continue;}
00328                                         
00329                         std::string strColumnName = strGroupName + "." + strTsvName + "." + strColumnName1;
00330                         if (setIgnore.find(strColumnName) != setIgnore.end()) {
00331                                 Verbose::out(1, "Skipping test for column : " + strColumnName);
00332                                 continue;
00333                         }
00334 
00335                         affx::File5_dtype_t iColumnType1 = tsv1->getColumnDtype(0, iColumnIndex);
00336                         affx::File5_dtype_t iColumnType2 = tsv2->getColumnDtype(0, iColumnIndex);
00337                         if (iColumnType1 != iColumnType2) {Verbose::out(1, "Tsv Column Types do not match for Group: " + strGroupName + ", Tsv: " + strTsvName + ", Column: " + strColumnName1); bSuccessful = false; continue;}
00338 
00339                         bool bNaNDiff = false;
00340                         int iRowIndex = 0;
00341                         while ((tsv1->nextLine() == affx::FILE5_OK) && (tsv2->nextLine() == affx::FILE5_OK))
00342                         {
00343                                 if (iColumnType1 == affx::FILE5_DTYPE_STRING)
00344                                 {
00345                                         tsv1->get(0, iColumnIndex, &str1);
00346                                         tsv2->get(0, iColumnIndex, &str2);
00347                                         if (str1 != str2) {Verbose::out(1, "Tsv Column Values do not match for Group: " + strGroupName + ", Tsv: " + strTsvName + ", Column: " + strColumnName1 + ", RowIndex = " + ToStr(iRowIndex) + ", Value1: " + str1 + ", Value2: " + str2); bSuccessful = false;}
00348                                 }
00349                                 else
00350                                 {
00351                                         switch (iColumnType1)
00352                                         {
00353                                         case affx::FILE5_DTYPE_DOUBLE:
00354                                                 tsv1->get(0, iColumnIndex, &d1);
00355                                                 tsv2->get(0, iColumnIndex, &d2);
00356                                                 break;
00357                                         case affx::FILE5_DTYPE_FLOAT:
00358                                                 tsv1->get(0, iColumnIndex, &f1);
00359                                                 tsv2->get(0, iColumnIndex, &f2);
00360                                                 d1 = f1;
00361                                                 d2 = f2;
00362                                                 break;
00363                                         case affx::FILE5_DTYPE_INT:
00364                                                 tsv1->get(0, iColumnIndex, &i1);
00365                                                 tsv2->get(0, iColumnIndex, &i2);
00366                                                 d1 = i1;
00367                                                 d2 = i2;
00368                                                 break;
00369                                         case affx::FILE5_DTYPE_CHAR:
00370                                                 tsv1->get(0, iColumnIndex, &c1);
00371                                                 tsv2->get(0, iColumnIndex, &c2);
00372                                                 d1 = c1;
00373                                                 d2 = c2;
00374                                                 break;
00375                                         default:
00376                                                 APT_ERR_ABORT("Unhandled case.")
00377                                                 break;
00378                                         }
00379                                         if(bAllowNegation)
00380                                         {
00381                                                 mx.set(iRowIndex, 0, fabs(d1));
00382                                                 mx.set(iRowIndex, 1, fabs(d2));
00383                                                 // Max can yield invalid results if either operand is NaN
00384                                                 if ((d1 != d1) || (d2 != d2))
00385                                                 {
00386                                                         // If flag NaN-num diff is true and not both d1 and d2 are NaN but one is, set flag.
00387                                                         if (flagNaNNumDiff && !((d1 != d1) && (d2 != d2))) { bNaNDiff = true; }
00388                                                 }
00389                                                 else
00390                                                 {
00391                                                         dMaxDifference = Max(dMaxDifference, fabs(fabs(d1) - fabs(d2)));
00392                                                 }
00393                                         }
00394                                         else
00395                                         {
00396                                                 mx.set(iRowIndex, 0, d1);
00397                                                 mx.set(iRowIndex, 1, d2);
00398                                                 // Max can yield invalid results if either operand is NaN
00399                                                 if (((d1 != d1) || (d2 != d2)))
00400                                                 {
00401                                                         // If flag NaN-num diff is true and not both d1 and d2 are NaN but one is, set flag.
00402                                                         if (flagNaNNumDiff && !((d1 != d1) && (d2 != d2))) {bNaNDiff = true; }
00403                                                 }
00404                                                 else
00405                                                 {
00406                                                         dMaxDifference = Max(dMaxDifference, fabs(d1 - d2));
00407                                                 }
00408                                         }
00409                                 }
00410                                 iRowIndex++;
00411                         }
00412                         double dCorrelation = mx.corr();                                        
00413 //                      Verbose::out(1, strGroupName + "." + strTsvName + "." + strColumnName1 + ", MaxDifference = " + ToStr(dMaxDifference) + ", Correlation:: " + ToStr(dCorrelation)); 
00414                         if (dMaxDifference > dEpsilon || bNaNDiff)
00415                         {
00416                                 if ((fabs(dCorrelation) < dCorrelationCutoff) || (dCorrelationCutoff == 1) || bNaNDiff)
00417                                 {
00418 #ifdef WIN32
00419                                         if (bNaNDiff) { dMaxDifference = ::sqrt(-1.); } // Sets to -1.#IND000000000000 and not 1.#QNAN like numeric_limits=<double>::quiet_NaN()
00420 #else
00421                                         if (bNaNDiff) { dMaxDifference = numeric_limits<double>::quiet_NaN(); }
00422 #endif
00423                                         Verbose::out(1, "Tsv Column Values are out of spec. for Group: " + strGroupName + ", Tsv: " + strTsvName + ", Column: " + strColumnName1 + ", MaxDifference = " + ToStr(dMaxDifference) + ", Correlation: " + ::getDouble(dCorrelation, 12)); 
00424                                         bSuccessful = false;
00425                                 }
00426                         }
00427                 }       
00428         }
00429         tsv1->close();
00430         tsv2->close();
00431         delete tsv1;
00432         delete tsv2;
00433 
00434         group1->close();
00435         group2->close();
00436         delete group1;
00437         delete group2;
00438 
00439         file1.close();
00440         file2.close();
00441 
00442         if (bSuccessful) {Verbose::out(1, "TSVs are equivalent.");}
00443 
00444         return bSuccessful;
00445 }
